      • Container

        public Container()
          throws Exception
        Construct a new, un-started container.
        Throws:
        Exception - If an error occurs performing classloading and initialization magic.

      • Container

        public Container(boolean debugBootstrap)
          throws Exception
        Construct a new, un-started container.
        Parameters:
        debugBootstrap - - flag to indicate if the module layer should be put into bootstrap debug mode. Same as the jboss-module -debuglog mode which enables trace logging to System.out during the initial bootstrap of the module layer.
        Throws:
        Exception - If an error occurs performing classloading and initialization magic.

                 URL xmlConfig)
          throws Exception
        Throws:

      • start

        public Container start(<any> deployment)
                throws Exception
        Start the container with a deployment.

        Effectively calls start().deploy(deployment)

        Parameters:
        deployment - The deployment to deploy.
        Returns:
        The container.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs.
        See Also:
        start(), #deploy(Archive)

      • deploy

        public Container deploy()
                 throws DeploymentException
        Deploy the default WAR deployment.

        For WAR-based applications, the primary WAR artifact iwll be deployed.

        Returns:
        The container.
        Throws:
        DeploymentException - if an error occurs.

      • deploy

        public Container deploy(<any> deployment)
                 throws DeploymentException
        Deploy an archive.
        Parameters:
        deployment - The ShrinkWrap archive to deploy.
        Returns:
        The container.
        Throws:
        DeploymentException - if an error occurs.

      • getArgs

      • setArgs

        public void setArgs(String[] args)
        Set the main method arguments. This will be available as a ValueService under the name wildfly.swarm.main-args
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed to the main(String[]) method.
